wikipedia_page.main: William Kirk Dickson (1860 – 14 July 1949) was a Scottish advocate, librarian and writer. He was Keeper of the Advocates' Library from 1906 to 1925, and Librarian of the National Library of Scotland from 1925 to 1931.

response: *William Kirk Dickson (1860–1949), Scottish advocate, librarian and writer
* William Kirk Dickson and his son, Rear Admiral Robert Kirk Dickson
* William Kirk Dickson , Advocate, librarian and writer, Keeper of the Advocates' Library and Librarian of the National Library of Scotland

link_mentions.page: List of alumni of the University of St Andrews

response: Notable residents include Thomas Duncan (painter) (1), William Kirk Dickson (3), George Joseph Bell (6), Edward Ramsay (7), Archibald Campbell Swinton and his son George Swinton (7), James Buchanan (1785-1857) (8), John Steell (11) and Robert Matthew (12).
